intro: Stemonurus punctatus, commonly known as the spotted bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features a rhizomatous root system and produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers with distinctive purple spots. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lanceolate leaves that are hairy on the underside. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Stemonurus punctatus is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cool, temperate climates.
